Summary: Great location  everyone was very nice. Just could hardly view the ocean through the fogged out sliders which was disappointing for a room advertised as ocean view. Free bike usage was very nice  pool area seemed nice but didn‚Äôt use due to cold weather

We loved our stay at Riviera Shores. The room was spotless with great balcony and grill. The view on the ocean was excellent. We loved the option to rent a bike for free which we used. Would love to come back one day! Amazing stay!

Summary Heading: Private BBQ on balcony while enjoying the view and sounds of the Pacific ocean!
Summary: This particular location of Diamond Resort has 3 phases each one with its unique qualities and each enjoyable for what they offer. The units are furnished to meet the guest who wants to enjoy not only quality stay indoors but also for the adventurer who can enjoy free bicycle outing on the beach or the walker who wants to walk via an overhead bridge. BBQ from the balcony while enjoying the Ocean breeze and sounds.

We returned to this property after 2 days for work. This location is right across the beach. The amenities inside the room is complete and clean. The room is very generous in square footage. This is how all hotels should look like.

The location of this property is Great. It is right on Pacific Coast Highway and the view of the Pacific Ocean was incredible.  The BUTS are a case of "It is what it is."  The property is located across the street from the train tracks that have trains going north and south about every 30 min. Pacific Coast Hwy is a busy street so if you're sensitive to noise, you may have a problem. We kept the door closed and it was fine. The cleanliness of our unit was a 10 all the way.  The walls are very thin and if there are any parties at night going on, you may want to crash them or wear ear plugs and headphones.  We did not use the amenities, which were many, because of our short stay. Parking was great and the location to be able to walk on the beach was excellent.

We LOVE this local get a way. The room is a spacious  room with a full kitchen. From the patio or balcony there is an ocean and sunset view. There are about 4 restaurants  within walking distance. More restaurants  are a short drive to Dana Point  Harbor

I found Riviera Beach & Shores Resorts after doing some research for a place to stay in Dana Point.  I reserved a "Deluxe Studio" room, and it turned out to be a very spacious suite with a small but complete kitchen and a nice comfortable living room with tv (including standard cable channels).  The room and all facilities were very clean, recently remodeled and nicely decorated, and there is free garage parking available (not the case with some other hotels in Dana Point).  Check-in was easy and fast, and the staff were helpful, friendly and efficient.  It also had free wifi in the room, which was very fast.  The resort  is across the road from the beach, but we did not try to access the beach here.  There is a fair amount of traffic on the 5-lane road, so it did not look very

GAVE MANAGEMENT A WEEK TO CALL AND MAKE IT RIGHT. HAVENT HEARD FROM ANYONE. So here we go; checked in last week for wifes bday weekend. We were given room 104. Check in was fine. Walking towards the room grounds on property were ok. Hallway leading to room has dirty and dated carpet. Entered the room and it was prob 3.5 star room. Good layout and balcony for beach view was cool. Turned on t.v. and layed on bed to look fir local restaurant. Browsing through my cell phone when my wife looks over and says what is that. Upon looking I thought it was lint or something but she said it was moving. We both got off the bed and sure enough it started to move. We caught it in a tissue and I checked the photo I took and sure enough a BED BUG. We immediatly got all of our bags and left the
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay. We regret to hear about the issues you had with your initial room and want to ensure you get your call as requested. Please email us at CustomerServiceSM@diamondresorts.com. -HN

Summary: This is a very nice resort with underground parking and easy access to units.  It is accross the street from the beach, and the train goes down the middle of the street and is fenced, so you can't immediately cross over.  The two outdoor pools are nice and have views of the beach.  Doheney Beach Park is very close, as are places to eat.  The suites are spacious and well furnished.  We were quite comfortable.  Our room didn't have a view of the beach, so I would recommend paying for an upgrade for the view.  The kitchen and bathrooms were nice and everything was very clean.
Manager Response: We're delighted you enjoyed your beach getaway with us! Thank you for leaving us a review. -RW

Summary: This is our second trip to this resort.  It was very clean and the view was amazing.  Right across from the beach!  Must use pedestrian bridge for walking access to beach or drive around.  Felt very safe with everyone wearing masks and limited capacity due to Covid-19.  The fully equipped kitchen was wonderful for family meals.  Definitely would visit here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know you had a great stay with us. We're happy to hear you felt safe and we hope you will come back and visit us again soon! Warmest regards. -GP

Summary Heading: Great location with an awesome view
Summary: I spent a girls only work weekend at the Riviera Shores Resort.  It was a little strange that you walk into the bedroom, then have to walk down a hallway to the kitchen, dining room and living room.  At the end, there is a good size balcony overlooking PCH (each balcony has its own Weber BBQ(!)), and across the street is the beach!  Doheny State Park and Campground is in walking distance.  The concierge gave us a welcome package with a 20% coupon to 3 different restaurants, all in walking distance from the resort.  The room is a little reversed, but worth it for the view.  The parking lot was easy to get to, and there were plenty of luggage carts to go around.  The main pool and Jacuzzi are a bit of trek, (it was at the very north end of the resort).  There is a family Jacuzzi
Manager Response: We're so glad to hear you had a great stay. Thank you for your fantastic review! -GP

Summary Heading: Great location, right across the street from the beach!
Summary: This is a timeshare condo resort. As an owner we are not pressured to go to any sales presentations, and we did not see any of the other guests being conned into one, either. Its a nice place! The 2 bedrooms do not have an ocean view so we chose a 1 bedroom. Great view! Nice private patio with a BBQ. Great spot to sit and enjoy the sunset. The rooms are nice and large with a full kitchen. Helps with saving a little money, you can buy snacks and cook. The bed was comfortable and the rest of the furniture was in good shape. You can borrow bikes and ride over to the beach, through the campground, which is fun. But the absolute best thing about this place is the location. You can get to so many things in less than an hour drive! If you have the chance to stay here, take it!
Manager Response: Thank you! Your feedback is cherished and we will be delighted to welcome you back on your future voyages. - HN

Summary: The remodel has helped tremendously. The room we booked was a two bedroom and the inside has been remodeled nicely. The pictures and paintings they added were a nice touch. Beach and surf picturesque give the hotel a nice beach feeling. The amenities and the availability of rental of beach necessities are a good add.
Manager Response: Thank you! Your feedback is cherished and we will be delighted to welcome you back on your future voyages. - HN

Summary: As the resort notes in its communication to visitors, and as other reviewers have noted, a major update is in progress.  Nevertheless, our one-bedroom unit was clean and entirely functional.  Little signs of age show, e.g. rusted hinges and peeling paint on the bottom of the bathroom door, but the update on the property is being done well.  Also, as both the resort and others have noted, the property overlooks a major highway, a railroad track, and a beach parking lot, so noise outside of the unit can be a distraction, but the view of the ocean is good, although it is available from only about half of the rooms (none of the two-bedroom units, as I understand the layout).  Despite the proximity to noise, soundproofing is good enough that my sleep was not at all disturbed.

Summary Heading: Very Tired Rundown, but Remodeling in Progress
Summary: This is a ‚Äúfixer upper‚Äù bought by Diamond Resorts a time share company. A few of the rooms have been remodeled and a few are in the process. It‚Äôs very tired and many features and amenities are either broken or non-operational. The only ice machine in our building that wasn‚Äôt broken was on the 4th floor. BEWARE: All the rooms on the back of the property face a concrete retaining wall literally 3 feet from your patio. Great view of rat traps and discarded trash. Our room was not a remodeled room. Bring a power strip as electrical wall outlets are scarce and the ones there are so worn and loose your plug can fall right out of the wall outlet. We did not have a walk-in shower, instead we had a HUGE jetted tub. There was a sign behind the shower curtain that said the tub jets did not
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with your feedback as this assists with any improvements that may need to be made. Our top priority is guest satisfaction, and we certainly understand the importance of efficiency and hope this issue has not deterred you from revisiting us in the future.

Summary: The check in was quick. The room itself is newly renovated. Very spacious. The bathroom is something else. The shower is huge . The drawback is it's right on the highway, so it's kinda noisy if you have the ocean front view.The train also goes by.

This is a Diamond Resort timeshare Hotel. It is available for reservations to other than timeshare owners. Located just 5  minutes from Dana Point harbor. A beautiful place to stay. Our room was along the front with views of the Harbor and the ocean. Beware of the location though, the Amtrak train comes by about every 30 minutes and is rather noisy. It is worth the stay for the short time that the train goes by for the views. Very clean room and spacious. A 1 bedroom will sleep 4 with a fold out couch. Best time to visit is between March and October. One final detail, there is no room service daily.

I can't believe this hotel has a bad review! The hotel was absolutely fabulous. We had a beach view room, huge rooms with amazing kitchen which had everything - pots, pans, LARGE fridge! The staff were so incredibly friendly. Free laundry services was a highlight given we'd been travelling over California the last two weeks and not one other hotel had a laundry service. Beautiful clean pool - not overly chlorenated. Loved laying out next to the pool, peaceful and quiet. Huge shower, would definitely stay here again! Very much enjoyed our stay. Free bikes for hire was awesome too.

This resort was a disappointment. Our funds would have been better spent else where. Through Diamond Resorts, we paid almost double the going rate of a rental. Not a good deal. Our unit was tired and in need of refurbishment. As the resort was right on the main street, the street noise was deafening at almost all hours. Someone down the hall was making a lot of noise. We notified the front desk, but nothing changed. We would not go here again.

Sometimes when you travel you find diamonds in the rough. This property is tired but has good bones. Recently acquired by Diamond Resorts it is in a renovation process. Our ocean view one bedroom was a contradiction. The bedroom and bathroom were spotless, modern, and clean. The kitchenette and living area was tired. The furniture needed updating and the kitchen cabinets and frig had seen hard service. But updates were also easily noticed across the hotel. The staff was accessible, helpful, and knowledgeable.   Yes it‚Äôs location is noisy. But its location is also its strength. The Mission, San Clemente, Laguna Beach, and San Diego are easily reached. While four stars now it certainly could earn a fifth after renovation.

Summary Heading: Noisy , not good for Down Time
Summary: The resort is across the street from the ocean : Parking lane 4 driving lanes plus center divider, another parking lane, a fence, train tracks, and then the beach font parking lot. You will not see the waves crash on the sand, you will not see the sand, you will only see the water past the other obstructions. Glass of wine or cup of coffee on the patio was not pleasant because of all the noise pollution. Hallway interior doors are constantly slamming and the walls are thin. If you don't plan to spend much time in the unit it will suffice as it is located near many attractions.

This hotel is in need of upgrade. The room we were in had old worn carpet and worn out furniture. The sofa cushions we're dilapidated. Since Diamond Resorts has taken over they have upgraded a few rooms but most need to be revived.  The hotel advertises as ocean view but those on the back side see dirt, a hill, or black plastic.  The convenience of parking in the underground garage was nice, as well as street parking right in front. The pool was in good shape but it was too cool to enjoy.  There is a small convenience type area, no on-site restaurants, but there are several within walking distance.  The ocean is across the highway. You must walk down the street about 1/4 mile, then up an over the bridge over the train track. Other reviews said the train was loud and annoying but

Summary Heading: Horribly dissapointed, definitely the ugly sister
Summary: An exchange through Interval, worst ever. Basically was told that as an II exchange we wer below the 3rd and lowest "tier" for their owners. We are on the second level directly across from the housekeeping area in a 2 bedroom unit that does have a balcony with a BBQ grill. BUT, directly behind is a retaing wall that goes up past 3rd floor, 3 feet away from building. It is so dark inside at 9 am that I have every light in the place on. There have been some update but nothing here is luxurious. The sofa is old and dirty, carpet was just cleaned but can not tell by looking. No walk in shower. Shower over the "old " jacuzzi tub in one bath and shower over tub in front bathroom in a bedroom with accordian doors that open to hall just inside door. With my husband and my mobility
Manager Response: Riviera Shores Resort appreciates your candid feedback. We work on a continuous basis to upkeep our resort and will continue to do so, as we strive to provide an optimum vacation experience to all members, owners, and guests. Front desk is accessible 24 hours and will assist immediately with any requests or concerns as we pride ourselves on being responsive and accommodating. We hope to see your Stay Vacationed‚Ñ¢ with us soon.

Summary: We booked this resort several months ago since the availability is scarce. Our check-in was seamless. We said no to the owner update a d were not pressured the rest of our stay. Our suite was ocean facing and the sunsets were phenomenal. We picked up food from the market and grilled on the patio. The fitness center was ok for a quick workout but taking advantage of the on-site and  "free" bikes was a better choice. Be biked up to Doheny and took in the scenes. Overall we were content with the stay. With nice restaurants within walking distance, we will be back for more RnR.

Great water view.  Helpful staff.  Nice room with kitchenette, table & chairs and sofa.  Extensive remodeling was going on during our stay.  This resort is part of the Diamond International system and they do make a strong effort to have their guests attend an informational session.  We used the bicycles available and found them to be rather old and in poor repair.  Really enjoyed the ocean view.

We visited this "resort" as part of the sampler package, which we purchased from Diamond Resorts as an opportunity to "date us before you marry us." Using this analogy, the Riviera Shores is the ugly sister of the person we thought we were dating. This location feels like a hotel, not a condo. Rooms are just ok, kitchen is functional but not great. Room felt dated but during the required timeshare presentation we learned that ours is actually one of the newly upgraded rooms. Balcony overlooks an extremely busy highway and train tracks which are used by commuter trains during the day and even noisier freight trains at night. The parking lot across the street is full of old campers running on generators 24/7 which adds to the noise.  Beach is accessible by foot bridge which was
Manager Response: We appreciate your membership and providing your candid feedback. We apologize for the inconvenience of the noise; we can understand how frustrating that may be to have to hear during your stay. It certainly is not our intent to mislead. One of our key priorities is to deliver the highest level of service, and our front desk is available 24 hours to immediately assist with any concerns and/or requests throughout your stay. Riviera Shores Resort would love to welcome you back and provide you the memorable vacations we are known for.

Summary: Ants in bed, bath and kitchen. Called for help and guard brought us a blanket per management instructions. We asked for wonder and cleaned up the ants. Slept on an uncomfortable sofa bed and after no one came the next day to clean/fix it we left a day early.
Manager Response: Riviera Shores Resort holds a vigorous pest control program, and we pride ourselves in being responsive and accommodating. We understand how these circumstances could have altered your view, and we assure you this is not our standard level of service. Diamond Resorts international¬Æ hopes you will give us an opportunity to present you with the extraordinary vacation experience we are known in providing.

Summary Heading: I'd Do It Again (with some alterations)
Summary: As most know this is a timeshare property. They want you to sit through a presentation that will only last 55 minutes. Well, it never has. It was an easy two hours. Anyway, it wasn't high pressure, the guy was nice but I'll pass next time.  I wrote a review about 18 months ago and commented on people's post of noise. It didn't bother us, but this time it was very noticeable. The first review was in January whereas this one was in July. The noise level on the highway is much higher due to more traffic and people at the beach. It was very noisy this time around. The train doesn't bother us. It does go by several times a day, but they are not long trains nor do they blow their horn.s  The thing we really liked this time around was the 4th of July fireworks show. Great view from the

Summary Heading: Overall,  a nice weekend get away.
Summary: Last Dec we got tortured into Diamond Resorts Sampler package. That was after 4 hours of saying no, I gave in.  The Sampler package is limited but we were able to book at the Riviera Shores Resort. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay. The staff is friendly and we had a studio overlooking the ocean. Unfortunately it also overlooks PC1 and the Coaster Train, so it's not a quite place with the sliding glass door open. Still, better than looking a the side of a cliff. This was not one of the new upgraded rooms so the room was nice but no "wow"factor. 3 stars. The bed was comfortable and you have two big TV's to watch. The best part was having a Weber BBQ on the porch. I cooked some good steaks to go along with sauteed mushrooms, bake potatoes and wine.   The location, other

Summary Heading: Good stay! Good location. In the middle of a needed upgrade.
Summary: Riviera is right on the beach on the PCH. Walking distance to the beach. Beach has firepits ready to use. Easy to get to off the highway. Rooms were clean, spacious, but a little outdated. We were on the back side of the facility with a gorgeous view of the retaining wall streaked with water marks. Couch was early 1980 and the cushion fabric was stretched making the couch pretty uncomfortable. Plenty of free parking. NIce little loung/game room with a pool table! 2 pools on premesis. Close to the Mission and downtown. 45 min to Newport Beach, 60 min to San Diego. Great location  We use our hotels as a "home base" so the minor inconviences aren't an issue. If you go to a DR and expect your rooms cleaned every day, stay at a hotel. If you want a view of the beach, request one and

We were in the newly remodeled building(It's the last one on the right as you enter the lobby.) We were in room 419 and had a great view of the ocean. I was also impressed that they have gas BBQs on every balcony. The beach is a short walk from the resort. and they have free bikes and helmets to use ( at least thirty plus children's. We were there a week and yes I went to a time share meeting for one hour. I didn't buy and walked out with a $125.00 visa card.

Came to this resort for a timeshare presentation. Our appointment was at 9am, we arrived early and were greeted just fine! As soon as they got wind that we were not interested after only a few questions...their hospitality ended there! They gave us their little group presentation and then when they took us to the room where u get an individual sales person come to show you the property and give you their sales pitch, we sat for over 20 minutes with not one person approaching us. All of the other couples that came in with us were talking with someone, had been offered drinks, snacks, and practically done! I got so irritated I grabbed the manager as he walked by and asked what the problem was! He gave me some lame excuse about being short on sales people but he could give us the
Manager Response: Riviera Shores Resort thanks you for attending one of our vacation ownership presentations. We pride ourselves in providing phenomenal customer service. If you felt otherwise, we assure you it is never our intent to provide a negative experience to our guests. Diamond Resorts International¬Æ welcomes you back for your future vacationing and look forward to seeing you at future presentations.

Summary: This is a wonderful location with a tired hotel. Interior doors need replacing,  bathtub drains are dirty,  bathtub caulking is way paste the "use date" and it just is tired.   Since I am an owner I am very unhappy with the situation. Maybe beach goers only care about the ocean?
Manager Response: Your feedback is greatly appreciated. Each year our HOA choreographs a budget that includes resort upkeep. A continuous effort will be made on improvements to maintain the resort and keep in line with the Diamond standard. We look forward to helping you Stay Vacationed‚Ñ¢ in the near future.

Summary Heading: Disappearing reservation, left without a room...
Summary: My parent's were supposed to celebrate their 45th wedding anniversary at this resort. TODAY!!!  Booked the stay in 2016 & modified the room type on March 20th (arriving April 14). Both, the 3rd party and I contacted the hotel on various occasions. Each and every-single time. Not an exaggeration. Literally, every time we called we were told "we don't have a reservation under that name". They would eventually find it and would confirm booking info.  It gets better though.  I called the hotel TODAY to see if I could get a late check-out for my parents. Again, can't find my reservation. They eventually find it BUT it has a check-in of the 17th instead of the 14th (TODAY). Of course, they're sold out and don't have a room for my parents...  I am beyond LIVID with this grossly
Manager Response: Reservations confirmed by our third party partners are of the upmost importance. Riviera Shores Resort prides itself on providing exceptional guest experience. We regret to hear that there appears to have been some miscommunication between your booking agent department and we understand how this disrupted your plans. Diamond Resorts International¬Æ does hope that we may get an opportunity to offer you a great vacation in the future, until then we wish you safe travels.

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights and will not stay ever again.  The room was spacious and nice but that's all I can say.  The room was cleaned only one time during the 7 day stay, that is their policy.  Also, this is a time share facility so there was a pitch to buy into it.  The sales lady called us 4 times and left a note on our door when we didn't come to the Saturday sales meeting.  It was a bit crazy! Beware!!

We were invited here to stay in exchange for us doing a time share presentation.  Nice place for an overnight or two, but I would never come here for an extended stay.  First off your ocean view rooms are right next to the Pacific Coast Highway, so if you want to take a book on the balcony to enjoy the ocean and relax, all you hear is the traffic.  The Pool is also right next to the highway, so while relaxing in the pool, instead of hearing the sounds of the ocean that is in close proximity, all you hear is the traffic.    There are some nice features including free bike rentals, guided hikes and classes, fitness center, close to Dana point harbor, but the poor location of being so close to the highway, in my opinion, negates all of these.  Sorry Riviera Shores not my favorite

Summary Heading: Stay away: They will try to sell you a time share!!!
Summary: Came for a relaxing weekend away. We arrived late on a Thursday for a 3 night stay. Was asked if I wanted to get reservations for a breakfast to listen to a sales pitch. I declined, but the concierge made reservations any way. When I didn't go to the breakfast/sales pitch I never agreed to attend, I was charged $20!!! The room was ok, but they were doing renovations. Many of the facilities were closed, and the work started at 7 in the morning... all three days we were there. It sounded like a car accident every time the work crew deposited materials in the dumpster near the parking lot. NOT restful or relaxing.  To top everything off, the room wasn't veryclean or well kept. Mildew in the bathroom. Pelling paint. The refrigerator wouldn't open all the way. Cheap plastic

Let me start this out by saying that I travel a lot. My family is platinum members with diamond resort and they got a few rooms for everyone. The rooms were loud at night because of the road and train, there is music playing in the hallway all night long (I've never seen a resort do this), and our fridge was humming all night long. We called for a blanket and they couldn't find one. What hotel didn't have an extra blanket!? When we talked to the staff they treated us like crap. The staff, management and facility are the worst I've ever dealt with. Save yourself the points because if you don't buy more then you are dead to this resort. I wish I could give this less than 1 star!
Manager Response: Thank you joshowebb for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We would like to assure you that the impression you have stated in your review after your recent experience at Riviera Shores Resort is not what we strive to offer our guests and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you have experienced. Rest assured that we take all comments and suggestions to heart so that we can improve and provide the exceptional service that our guests expect and deserve. We sincerely appreciate you being a member with Diamond Resorts International and your interest in Riviera Shores Resort, and we look forward to a more positive association with you in the future.

Summary: We are Diamond Resorts members. Riviera Shores was easy to get into (two ocean view suites) on relatively short notice. We wanted something close to an airport (Orange County) and Disneyland.  This worked well for short..under an hour ... drives. We had a group of six adults and three children. The rooms were comfortably furnished. The bed and linens and pillows were good quality.  The pull out couch in the living room was much more comfortable than the usual foldout.  We were provided with a crib and high hair.  The kitchen is basic but everything worked. When asked the staff was quick to provide any extras (detergent and even a blowup mattress). Good quality flat screens in both the living and bedroom. The workout room was utilitarian.  Laundry available on the third floor.

Summary Heading: Choice of no view or plenty of noise
Summary: The general location of this resort near Dana Point is good, but the exact location is troubling.  I realize that there is nothing that can be done to move it, but there are no real grounds and if the room is not an ocean view, there is no view.   But to see the ocean from the room, one must look over the Coast Highway, the railroad tracks, and the parking lot filled with RVs.  The traffic and trains make this noisy at times.  I do not think that the entire resort has been remodeled.  At least the Phase I building does not appear to be.  While the room was clean and everything worked as expected, there was no indication of seeming new.  The musty, mildewy smell in the hallway after coming in from the garage was not pleasant.  This was a timeshare exchange so we were here for a

We are Diamond owners and had talked to other owners who had stayed here. The reviews were mixed as are the reviews on TripAdvisor.   We tossed a coin and decided to try it. During the booking process and a couple times subsequently we were notified that this property does not meet standard and is in the process of being remodeled. Honestly, our expectations were pretty low upon arrival, but we enjoyed ourselves.   There is a lot of car noise and several trains go by each day but you can also hear the ocean, so I guess it's a matter of focus. Our bed was a King size and very nice although the room was quite tight, but we weren't there to stay in the bedroom. The rest of the unit was spacious. The sofa and chair were old and probably the biggest negative for us. The pool and

Over all a pleasant experience. Friendly and helpful staff. Need to chose the higher floors ask for ocean view.  Do not use the couch for a bed, need a 2 bedroom.  Remodeling is in progress.  If you want coffee etc., bring it yourself.  They only supply a starter kit. (one decafe, one regular)

While the location and ocean view is exceptional at this Diamond Resort, it still leaves quite a bit to be desired.  I stayed here with my girlfriend for a short girl's get away trip. We knew it was only a one bedroom but the one bedroom units at most Diamond Resorts are a king and we felt we could live with that.  Turned out to be a queen which was not for us but we also knew it had a pull out couch as a backup.  The pull out bed in the couch, however, was unusable.....way too uncomfortable.The condition of the couch in general  was deplorable.  The chair wasn't much better.  To sit on either, one had to put a pillow behind your back and even then it was impossible to be comfortable. Both should have been replaced at least couple of years ago.    The kitchen and bath in the

Disappointed in the accommodations.  We had a one bedroom that needed updating desperately.   All rooms have ocean view which was nice.   Many restaurants within walking distance with a variety of cuisines.   There was a gas Webber grill on our deck and we used it several times.  Laundry facilities on site were free.  We had a car do were able to drive around the area and eat at other restaurants.
Manager Response: We regret your time here at Riviera Shores Resort Capistrano Beach fell short of your expectations. Please accept our apologies for the room condition complications you endured.  We are pleased you found our dining venues nearby quite excellent, and enjoyed our resort amentines. We value your complete satisfaction, and hope to better meet your needs in the future.  Sincerely,

Summary: We spent 4 night at the resort at the end of August beginning if September and had a most enjoyable stay.  The location is very good and a very short walk (1block) to the highway and train track overpass to the beach area.  The beach is nothing special opposite the units buy we only went to kick back not to swin or body surf. The unit was clean and fairly spacious, some things dated but well kept.  The bedroom a little dark and the TV older but that i can live with that as it was clean. We used both polls and actually found the small pool very nice.....almost no one there and the configuration much better than the large pool.  The large pool has smaller walk ways between the pool and lounges and the bathroom could use a little cleaning and sprucing up. The staff was most

1.0 star rating 7/8/2015 The most horrible experience with customer service... We booked 2 bedrooms apart ocean view with booking.com.when when we arrive there they gave us an apartment facing a wall .we tried to change it they said no availability,and they refuse to cooperate to give us 2 separate rooms ocean view or even change our room to a better view than the wall one.Everytime we tried the resort director hide in his office and refuse to talk,and since he doesn't want to talk we got so frustrated.he decided to call the police for us to ask us to leave.we left soon shocked ,we never thought the situation will escalate,and ruined our vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your opinion about our resort, based on your recent personal experience here. We apologize that we could not accommodate your request for the room type you booked at check in. We immediately addressed this to prevent this from happening to any future guests of the resort.  While we realize that this may have been upsetting to you and your party, we could not allow the level of confrontational and aggressive behavior you all were displaying, out of frustration, to continue in the presence of other guests as guest safety is always top priority here.  We have since refunded your money from booking.com and we wish you and your party have great vacation experiences in the future.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, location and awesome staff...will come back!
Summary: We had a great weeks stay at this hotel. Everyone was very accommodating and friendly. Loved our room and the location overlooking the ocean! Centrally located to restaurants and beaches. Will recommend to others and plan to return and stay at this hotel again üòÄ

Summary Heading: Give it a chance - great location and awesome staff!
Summary: We weren't sure what to expect based on some reviews but, overall, were very happy with our stay here.  We stayed in a 2 bdrm unit with 2 baths and kitchen.  Excellent location - across the street from the beach and a walkway across the highway is just down the street from the resort.  Yes, it is on the Pacific Coast Highway but we didn't spend enough time in the room to be bothered much.  Just couldn't keep the patio door open during busy periods.  Yes, the train tracks are across the street and there are multiple trains throughout the day but we aren't talking freight trains.  These are commuter trains with approximately 5 cars per train so about the time you think about noise, the train has passed.  Our room was very clean and the kitchen was well equipped.  The gas grill on

Summary Heading: A HUGE dresser fell on our son!
Summary: A huge, heavy dresser with an unattached glass top and big TV fell on top of our 6 year old son!  Our son was sitting on the floor with the bottom two drawers open when the entire dresser fell away from the wall on top of him.  Luckily my husband and I were in the same room at the time!  My husband managed to leap to our son, throw the TV out of the way and pull our son out.  It was an unbelievably scary situation!  Our son sustained a huge scratch on his back and one on his leg.    When we called the front desk to report the situation and speak to a manager, the woman told us that she could send up someone from maintenance.  No manager was available (she was not concerned in the least.  Didn't even ask if our son was OK!).  Even after we described the severity of the situation,
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at Riviera Shores Resort.  We are disheartened to hear of your experience but are glad to hear that your son is ok and that you are currently in communication with our Resort Manager in regards to this matter.

Summary: As Diamond property, this place is more of a lump of coal. This is a very noisy and dated property.  The one bed-room unit should be advertised as an efficiency, it had a very small cramped bedroom with a double bed and two large cabinets (one containing a TV) which were used to make a wall. It was difficult for two people to move around in this bedroom when the cabinet doors to view the TV were opened. The microwave in our unit was new, but the refrigerator, cabinets, stove top, were dated. You can either see the ocean and beach (a noisy busy highway and train prevent hearing the waves) or face a dirt cliff wall. There is a small patio which we used in the evening when the traffic noise was less.  The property claims to be 'green' however there is not a recycle bin to be
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at Riviera Shores Resort.  We are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay and acknowledge that our property is dated in some respects and are working on a multi-year renovation of the property to bring it up to the standards that members and guests of Diamond Resorts have come to expect.  Please be assured that we do in fact recycle! All trash that is collected from the garbage receptacles in each of our three parking garages is disposed of and sorted at the local waste management facility.  We hope that the service our staff provided you, exceeded your expectations and that you enjoyed our amenities and proximity to the beach and that your experience will not deter you from staying with us again in the future.

Summary: I completely agree with other posted comments, this is not a resort and definitely not worth the nightly rate charged for the accommodations. I booked and thought I prepaid for two nights via hotel reservation site.  Upon arrival informed there was an additional "resort fee" of $22.  This property appears to be more interested in selling timeshares than catering to overnight prepaid guests.  No house keeping unless you book five nights or longer, then you get it once. Coffee in room for one night only, no coffee in lobby, no complimentary newspaper.  Walls and ceilings are not insulated for sound, so you hear what is moving above you, what is playing on the television in the rooms next to you and anything else that is happening.  Couch was cheap and uncomfortable.  We did not

I would not call this a resort.  They have a pool and exercise room, but it is more like a strip mall--lots of buildings along the busy Pacific Coast Hwy.  I debated between 3 and 4 stars, but chose 4 because the staff is so friendly and helpful.  The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was fine.  The kitchen facilities are adequate, not much better.  The furniture in the living room wasn't real comfortable to sit on.  There is a nice BBQ grill on the balcony which we used.  We were on the ocean side, 4th floor, and enjoyed looking at the ocean, but it was noisy when we were in the living area--too noisy to keep the sliding glass door open with the TV on.  However, the noise didn't bother us in the bedroom at night.  That said, there were a few things that drove me nuts.  They
Manager Response: At Riviera Shores Resort, one of the newest resorts added to our branded hospitality family, it is our goal to provide the highest level of guest satisfaction with our wide array of resort services and amenities. Our resort has been part of an acquisition and is now under new management. As such, we have already begun taking the appropriate steps to correct the issues described by you. Although the furniture may be considered out dated in some units, we are working hard to ensure that each guestroom will be brought up to our Diamond standard of amenities, which will soon include flat screen televisions, name brand appliances, premium bedding and linens and much much more. It is regrettable that there are times when persistent noise disturbances, such as street noises and boisterous vacationers can defeat the best of our efforts however, we appreciate your feedback as we strive to provide the best soundproofing between rooms that we can.   If you are willing to give us another chance once these refurbishments have been completed, we are extremely confident that your next stay will be much more enjoyable and even exceed your expectations.

Summary: The biggest problem NOISE!  Constant traffic, trains, moaning plumbing, non-stop humming/vibrating walls from the AC or generator. You couldn't leave the windows open, the noise was louder than the tv & forget about sleeping even with ear plugs.  The sofa was old/beat up & the room decor cheap.  I had reservations for 4 nights, we left after 1.  The desk must be used to the complaints. When I politely explained my issues, the guy couldn't even look at me, he mumbled sorry & I actually felt sorry for him working there.
Manager Response: At Riviera Shores Resort, one of the newest resorts added to our branded hospitality family, it is our goal to provide the highest level of guest satisfaction with our wide array of resort services and amenities. Our resort has been part of an acquisition and is now under new management. As such, we have already begun taking the appropriate steps to correct the issues described by you. Although the furniture may be considered out dated in some units, we are working hard to ensure that each guestroom will be brought up to our Diamond standard of amenities which will soon include flat screen televisions, name brand appliances, premium bedding and linens and much much more.   If you are willing to give us another chance once these refurbishments have been completed, we are extremely confident that your next stay will be much more enjoyable and even exceed your expectations. We sincerely appreciate your business with us and wish you and your friend the best on all your future travels.

Summary: We stayed at Riviera Shores Resort for our honeymoon and we were very happy with our stay.  The staff was wonderful! The resort is located across the street from a beach, however we would recommend checking out the beaches closer to Laguna Beach.  The beach across from the hotel is a bit rocky.  There is a train track between the resort and beach as some folks mentioned--the train is gone within thirty seconds and did not bother us at all! Ask for an ocean view room so you can wake up to the beautiful ocean every morning.  Overall we would 100% recommend this resort!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our resort for your honeymoon getaway! Our team members will be thrilled that you were pleased with their friendly service.  We hope that your stay was a memorable one and that you will visit us again in the future!

Summary: Reasonably priced.  Good location.  Nicely sized rooms.  Those are the pluses. The  trade-offs: signage could be improved: place is massive with connecting buildings.  Easy to get lost.  Bathrooms could be updated and the resort fee is a nuisance particularly if you don't use the pool (we didn't).

There were many positives: Nice balcony, beach view, good location, nice bathroom with good towels, good internet connection, and friendly staff.  But there are negatives: Ants in the kitchen area of the room (they did quickly come and spray when we let them know), a strong mildew odor in the room, a concierge call to a restaurant many hours after the initial request (never mentioned to us, and made for awkward moments at the restaurant), and a place that bills itself as a "resort and spa" should have a robe or two in the room.  The new owners are obviously making an effort, but while they get the bugs out (figuratively and literally) they might consider suspending the daily resort fee until they can properly refer to themselves as a resort.

Summary Heading: Great loacation in betweeb SD & LA
Summary: We recently stayed at the Riviera Shores Resort and were very happy with the amenities. Everthing you needed,   full kitchen, everything you need for the bathroom, a TV in the living room & Bedroom and even a Weber gas BBQ on the patio . It was with an ocean view but the downside was that it is located right on the Coast highway,  with the trainstracks right next to that - THEN you had a view of the ocean. It is less than an hour's drive to the but if you are looking for a relaxing beach getaway - this probably isn't it. The staff were great and there was alway plenty of free underground parking. We would go again if we are looking for a nice place to use as a base camp while we check out the nearby activities.The free wifi  worked well also. I will also add that this is a newly

My husband, infant daughter and I stayed in the 1 bedroom unit for two nights booked through priceline.  I was very pleased with the full living room and kitchen.  When you travel with a baby you bring a lot of stuff and we had plenty of room.  They provided a crib at no charge which was refreshing compared to other hotels.  The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly.  I was only asked about "discount vacation options" (aka timeshare) once and it was pretty much like staying in a normal hotel.  The main sleeping area was placed at the back of the unit away from the street/ocean so there was not much of a noise problem back there.  You will hear a lot of street noise and train noise in the living room area.  The ocean view was nice but hard to enjoy from the 2nd

I enjoyed my stay! Its an older beach hotel, I personally like the older hotels, theirs some charm and history here. Great  location, nice staff, good breakfast. right across from beach. Great biking trails right their

Very disappointing if you look for a resort type stay. Although booked way in advance we were assigned a room facing the back meaning facing a huge retaining wall. Not a place were you want to have a glass of wine and relax on the balcony. The room had all the things advertised but it was so dark and depressing; hardly any daylight. We tried to get another room assigned but to no avail. Front desk wasted one hour of our time even though they knew they did not have an alternative. We can say though that the Manager talked to Hotel.com and we were refunded our money after refusing to stay in that room. Hotel.com should disclose that the backrooms face an ugly, stained wall. We certainly would have booked a different room had we known. It is not a place we would go back to and we

You can tell that this is a great up and coming Resort.   The bad: When we pulled into the parking garage, there was not ONE sign as to where to go for check in.  This got a bit frustrating as we walked all over searching before we finally found it, about a block down the road!  MUST POST SOME SIGNS!! We could not figure out how to turn the bathroom hot tub on.  I have one at home and it doesn't seem like it would be that hard, but it was not easy. The balcony is glass and it butts right up to your neighbor.  Privacy is not to be found on the balcony!  The Good: Just about everything! The view......gorgeous ocean kitchen that is fully stocked large bathroom many extras, such as free rental for bikes and pool toys comfy bed and suburb linens great pool and hot tub areas nice

Summary Heading: Nice location in SoCal but not for everybody
Summary: This is not your type of place if you want a beautiful view, and a peaceful environment. Sitting on the balcony and enjoying just the sounds of the ocean and kids playing on the beach will not happen here. While the speed-line train does go by multiple times a day, it is usually pretty quick to pass by in less than 20 seconds. The freight train at night (9-10pm) can be 60+ cars long and rumbles by for a few minutes. These were more of an annoyance for us. What was more disturbing was the constant traffic of the PCH. It seems to be non-stop cars all day and pretty late into the evenings, 10-11 at night. We were out most of the day, so coming back to eat and relax just wasn‚Äôt happening. Being on the 4th floor and looking over the PCH past train tracks and over the car/RV parking

7 days 6 nights.  Large 2br 2ba with full kitchen, living room and full dining area,  new appliance (convection microwave oven) gas grill on private patio  Beach across the street, bikes for rent. Along pacific coast highway easy access to IH5.

Summary Heading: 3,000 miles to look at a retaining wall!
Summary: My husband and I flew across country to spend our 36th anniversary in sunny California on a time  share exchange. Opened the door to our unit at Riviera Shores to face a dirty retaining wall! Spoke to the manager and was told no openings elsewhere and that they would call us during the week to change our space.. Of course no one ever called...very discouraging!  Also asked the concierge how we could get to LA on a tour and he had no clue that  we could take the train from San Juan Capistrano and meet a tour at the nearest hotel to Union Station. I called around myself and set the whole thing up...very low class place in a very nice area...
Manager Response: We regret to hear of your dissatisfaction with your recent room‚Äôs view.  Our team is certainly never happy to hear that a guest is not satisfied with every aspect of their stay. We sincerely apologize that we were unable to accommodate your request for a new room, as we are subject to the availability at the time of your stay. Our team members pride themselves in being readily available to assist with any guest‚Äôs needs, and we truly regret to hear this was not your feeling. Your concerns regarding the knowledge of our Concierge team member has been forwarded on to his manager for further review and coaching purposes. Your feedback is much appreciated, and we hope that you will give us another chance to make a better impression on you in the future.

Summary: Booked a one night stay here but it would've been great for much longer. A great room with two bedrooms, a pull out double sofa bed in the large lounge, dining area and a sizeable well-equipped kitchen. Also a balcony. All in perfect condition. The only negative thing to mention is that location near Highway 1 and the railway. This having been said, I managed to sleep fine although I am normally not good at sleeping near noise.

√è gave this property an average rating only because of the very pleasant staff and the fact that the room was very clean and appropriately appointed. The small open kitchenette had sufficient dishes, cookware and serving pieces (including a rather nice glass salad bowl and tong set). Beyond that there is no way we would recommend this location to anyone due to just that: the location! We were on the third floor with a balcony and ocean view. Unfortunately we could not even open our sliding door because of the non-stop LOUD traffic right below our window. Across the road (Pacific Coast Highway) there's a train track....again...very frequent and VERY LOUD! Beyond the train tracks there is a parking lot for the beach where apparently overnight parking of RV's and trailers is

This was a last minute booking to attend a memorial service for a friend. I saw the location on Expedia and on Orbitz but through them the time frame was not available. I must say that the travel companies had about a 40% discount on the room rate. After reading the reviews and looking at the photos I hesitated but decided to give it a try. I am so glad I did. The unit is much nicer than the photos. I called directly to the hotel and I must admit again I was a little concerned as the person on the phone didn't really seem to know what he was doing. It took quite a while to get the reservation. The 4 o'clock check-in was a little inconvenient but we drove south to visit friends and arrived on a Friday night about 8pm. We must have lucked out because we never saw or heard the

If you ever wanted to know what a timeshare property looks like from the Diamond Resort International company, this is it.  This property is located in Dana Point, CA, also known as Capistrano Beach. The property is actually a hotel, not a resort. What is the difference, you may ask? Well, this place is more like a run-down 80's hotel with narrow hallways and worn out, stained carpets.  The room service and maid/cleaning service are almost non-existent, let alone a reliable concierge service, who seems to always be somewhere else when needed. The room cleaning ladies come around weekly, rather than daily. Other factors that influence the general ambience that most other reviewers have mentioned, such as thin walls, noisy train, large lot full of campers, and lack of easy beach
Manager Response: First of all, thank you for choosing to stay with us at Riviera Shores Resort.  We are really sorry for the impression of the resort that you have gained on this occasion and we assure you we are equally disappointed that we missed the opportunity to impress you with the quality of our accommodation. Our resort has been part of a recent acquisition and is now under new management.  As such, we have already begun taking the appropriate steps to correct the issues described by you. We begin our projects in the guest units by replacing guest room carpet, flat screen televisions in the master bedroom and new ottomans in the living rooms. We will also enhance the common area with new furniture and exterior lighting to brighten up the entrance to the resort. Additionally, we will replace carpet in the hallways and apply a fresh coat of paint to hallways and interior stairwells. We are grateful for your flexibility and patience during this transitional phase. Our resort is pleased to offer underground covered parking for those who select to use it. The clearance height for this entrance is six feet. If your vehicle is taller than six feet, please park in any available stall around our buildings.   We would like to welcome you back to our resort in the future and hope you will enjoy our enhancements the next time you visit.

Summary: I was looking for a place to spend a few relaxing days leading up to thanksgiving. My usual go to spot at the dana point marina inn was way over our budget. I logged into Expedia and found a killer deal at Rivera shores. Having stayed a few years back with a friend with a timeshare here, I knew how nice it was, but was not expecting a great room at the price I paid. Surprise!! Third level, full ocean view, nice!  They ask on check in if you want someone to contact you re timeshare info. I checked no, and no one ever bothered us. Suites are very roomy, with kitchen fully supplied, full size fridge, range, coffee pot, toaster, dishwasher. Plus BBQ on the deck. You could prepare meals here every day if you like. No daily maid service. Not a problem for us. If you are very sensitive

Stayed here while surfing trestles.  3 Min drive to San Clemente. ($14 cab ride to the Triangle or Del Mar) there is also a bar and a couple restaurants in the next couple buildings that you can walk to.     Rooms are huge! got a 2 bedroom, big clean rooms, full kitchen..living room.  pool is nice.  instead of packing in a San Clemente hotel with a group of 3 or more, stay here instead.

Summary Heading: Great beach get away for couples and families
Summary: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this condo resort directly across the street from a state beach. The unit was spacious and clean, featured a fully equipped kitchen, and offered beach views from both the deck off the living room and the large window in the bedroom. An added plus was a gas barbecue on the deck, and we liked the underground parking. We enjoyed the inexpensive beach cruiser bike rentals, video arcade, large pool, and soothing Jacuzzis. Riviera Shores is close to Dana Point Harbor, and we enjoyed a bike cruise by the state beach and through this scenic harbor area. The resort seems very family friendly, and offers something for everyone. Three restaurants are just a short stroll away. We will return!

Summary Heading: This place is simple, clean and convenient....very nice.
Summary: I stay here every year in May and it is always a treat. Very convenient to get to the beach, Excellent service, and well taken care of. Plenty of things to do nearby with Doheny State Beach, plenty of restaurants, and entertainment - there's always something going on -somewhere nearby.

Summary Heading: Surprised and I'm a hero now.
Summary: I hadn't stayed here before, and I was taking a risk since my girlfriend from Seattle was flying in to be with me.  As soon as we entered and she saw the unit and the view of the ocean she blurted out "I love it!"  We only spent two nights, but they were wonderful, the place was clean, the staff attentive if needed, and niether of us was bothered in the least by the traffice on PCH or the trains going by across the street.  The bed was comfortable, I wasn't bothered by my neighbors and everything worked as it should.  The only negative was that the closest elevator was down at our checkout time.  They are in the process of renovating several rooms here and at the sister resort next door, but I took that as a plus.

Nice two bedroom/two bath unit with kitchen, dining, and living areas.  But you can hear everything in the units around you.  People talking, moving chairs, running a shower, open/close doors, etc.  Stay here if you are a sound sleeper or if you party till 4am (you'll keep everyone else up, but you'll be fine). The units were very nice, but I prefer a concrete building. The building is long and narrow and is wedged between the hillside and the coast hwy.  The rear units literally face a retaining wall holding up the cliff-side (you could reach out and touch it, you may as well not have windows).  The front units overlook the coast hwy and the train tracks just across the street. They have a beach/ocean view.  We had a rear unit and it seems that all the conversations in the

I needed an affordable place to stay while on business, and this fit the bill.  It was definitely an interesting mix of amenities and services.  It was clear tha most guests were vacationing, which was fine.  The front of the hotel has a lovely view of the ocean, while the back looks at a wall of dirt.  The downside to the front of the hotel is noise- a major road and an active train track run just in front of the hotel.  I found the trains bothersome the first night, but really didn't hear them after that.    The biggest advantage to this place is the full kitchen in each unit.  And I mean full kitchen!  Range top, full size fridge, nicest microwave I've ever seen, dishwasher, regular size coffee pot, blender (!), all the dishes, pots, and pans you could want, PLUS, a full size

Would have been perfect if Amtrak and Metrolink trains didn't roar thru every few hours especially at 6am.  Beach was very rocky and need to cross over highway via a walkway about 2 blocks away.  Staff was pleasant but not overly so.  Lots of road noise from traffic.  Easy ride to Dana Point which was scenic quiet and peaceful.

We stayed at the Riviera Shores May 18 - 20, 2012 while attending the Doheney Blues Festival. There is a pedestrian overpass nearby which takes you over the Pacific Coast highway and the railway to the beach. The Blues Fest provided a complimentary shuttle service to the Festival which was a couple of miles away. We were on the fourth floor so didn't find the passing trains too disruptive. Large balcony with a BBQ. The kitchens are well equipped for those who wish to cook their own meals. The rooms were well appointed and good value @ $141 CDN/night.  We made use of the large pool, however one of the hot tubs looked a bit "green". Extra charges for room WiFi. Front end staff very friendly and accommodating.

Our anniversary was in April, so my husband booked a surprise retreat to this resort. We stayed in the one bedroom. We had been here before about 2 yrs. ago. Since then I noticed they have done a few upgrades. They updated the kitchen cabinets and appliances and they updated the bedroom mattresses and bedspreads to a more comfortable & modern look. Also they upgraded the TV from the bedroom. We saved a lot on eating out since we took food to cook/ grill. They have a kitchen supplied with everything one can need and they have a gas grill in the balcony. They also have salt and pepper and complimentary coffee for the first two nights, more is available in the vending  machines. The unit was huge, and it had a huge jacuzzi,  which we enjoyed very much. They  have onsite bike
The people at Riviera Shores always treat my wife and me very well.  We always look forward to visiting Riviera Shores.

We had a free timeshare week with Trading Places Int'l in Laguna Niguel.  They found an opening in this resort for us.  It was a 1 bedroom, nice large bathroom and the kitchen was fully stocked with everything one might need.  The lanai was nice to sit on at night with a cocktail and coffee in the morning.  There was a bbq on the lanai also which we didn't use.  The only problem we had was that the bed was soooo hard we hurt.  So we went to a Walmart and bought a foam topper and that did the trick.  The pillows were also hard, so I bought a cheap one to use.  All in all we had a nice time during the tall ships festival.

The location of the resort it self is very close to the beach and the crossing bridge. The room is spacious and CLEAN, which is very important to us. We stayed there for a week, and we have every tool we need to cook in the kitchen. They also have an electric BBQ on the patio of each unit facing the beach and we enjoy the view while we wait our meals. The service is excellent as well. They provide beach amenity and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The maintenance staff resolve the problem quickly when we need help with the video player operation. We came on Sunday and on Thursday the house keeper clean all the trash and replace all the towels.

I put in a request for a resort near Anaheim, CA with Interval International and this is the ony resort available for the time I needed to be in CA.  After reading some of the reviews on this site, I was weary about what I would find.  However, from the time I arrived until the time I left my stay at the resort was very positive.  The room I was in was clean and had everything I needed in it to be comfortable.  Now I don't think I would stay at this resort if I just wanted to stay there and relax but that is only because of the traffic and the train that passes by it seems like every 10 minutes.  It is a little noisy.  My only complaint is that they do not have free Wifi other than that, I would return back!

Summary Heading: Great Location not Great TimeShare- very old, loud rooms!
Summary: Time Share hotel right near Dana Point Harbor. The location is fine, right across PCH from the beach. You can access the beach via a walking bridge & you can ride bikes to Dana Point or San Clemente without too much difficulty. The positives pretty much stop there. The one bedroom has a wall around the bedroom that stops 3 feet from the ceiling as does the door for the bedroom, not private by any means. The Interval site lists a resteraunt on the 4th floor- not so, it closed more than 6 months ago! The doors for the rooms don't seal so every time someone else shuts their door your door rattles and it sounds like someone is coming into your room! The people in the room above can be heard very well as the place seriously lacks insullation! The train on the other hand was not a

The rooms are clean, and everything you need to cook and eat are there.  We stayed for a week so there was plenty of chances for a messed up experience, but none happened.  Except for the fact that the wake-up call never happened is the only thing that was wrong with our stay, so maybe setting the alarm is suggested.  The staff is extremely helpfull, coutious, and knowledgeable about the attractions near the timeshare.  I also upgraded my ownership, so the service is top drawer.  I would recomend this place to anyone.  I'm even planning my next vacation which isn't until april, and this resort is ganna be my place to be.

We stayed at Riviera Shores the last week in May with our 4 children, ages 8 to 19.  The resort is older and kind of a no-frills place, however our 2 bedroom suite was extremely spacious and fairly comfortable with a living room, dining room, balcony with bbq, kitchen and 2 bathrooms.  The master bedroom was enormous and included a double sink and jetted tub.  The 2 bedroom suites do not have an ocean view but look out on a steep hillside.  The pool was adequate and appeared to be clean.  We were able to check out bicycles to ride along the beach.  We didn't participate in any of the (very few) resort activities or eat in the restaurant.  The restaurant didn't look too tempting.  It wasn't an elegant place but was a good place to crash after a busy day at Disney, San Diego, or

This past week, we have stayed at the Riviera Shores Resort which for the most part was okay however the train that passes through is really difficult to sleep through. It also has really thin walls that betray every noise from your neighbors. And the room shakes a little when the train rumbles pass. A little discerning as it feels like an earthquake.    However the end of our trip was ruined. The second to last day of our stay, we decided to rent out bikes from the Riviera to go cycling. However upon trying to unlock the broken lock, the key snapped. We went back to the people to tell them and they told us we now owed $20 for a broken lock. After talking to the manager the lock price was reduced to $10.    On our last day we had to pass the bike rack to get to the parking lot

I stayed here with my family for a week.  The location was fabulous.  We stayed on the 4th floor  in a 1 bedroom since they are the ones with a view.  Although it was only a 1 bedroom, it was plenty spacious for our family of 4.  We particularly liked the fact that we had a kitchenette and our own bbq on our balcony.  We were able to grill steaks and corn on the cob one night, and grill hot dogs and hamburgers for the 4th of July.  We had perfect seats for the fireworks held on the ocean, right across the street from us!  Doheny State Beach is also right across the way via a pedestrian bridge.
